doc.name: longFilePath
doc.summary: Returns the long-format equivalent of an 8.3-format file path.

examples.example: if storedPath is not the longFilePath of storedFile then checkVersion

description.p: Use the longFilePath function to get the long equivalent of a short file path passed from the command line.
The filePath is the location and name of the file or folder whose long equivalent you want. If you specify a name but not a location, LiveCode assumes the file or folder is in the defaultFolder.
The longFilePath function returns a file path.
The longFilePath function transforms the filePath without looking for the file, so it returns a value even if the filePath does not exist.
On Mac OS, OS X, or Unix systems, the longFilePath function simply returns the filePath without changing it.
